snippet: After decades of decline, malls across the country are being redeveloped by communities and planners trying to forge new gathering places out of vast lots with empty buildings.
abstract: Urban planners and community activists across the country are attempting to find different uses outside of retail stores for the vacant spaces left in malls; vacancy rates in malls are at near-record levels due to both the worst recession since the advent of malls and competition with the Internet.
lead_paragraph: After decades of decline, malls across the country are being redeveloped by communities and planners trying to forge new gathering places out of vast lots with empty buildings.

headline.seo: Making Over the Mall With Parks and Sermons
headline.main: How About Gardening or Golfing at the Mall?
headline.print_headline: How About Gardening or Golfing at the Mall?
